Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: inga_kovalonoka
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. Normal 3* hotel near metro station ( Bologna),just you go out from metro station and you are at Your hotel doors. rooms ar quite small, but normal. around 300m from hotel are big supermarket. hotel staff ar friendly, but DONT speak english at all! Breakfast are cold. only bread bread, cruasans and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: warzasaw
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was really good considering if you already know how to get around Rome as the staff were incredibly rude and un helpful, only one lady speaks English. The rooms were incredibly small and the bathroom, especially the shower were disgusting, the supposed cleaning of the rooms everyday is a lie. The included breakfast was a joke, by the Second day we were sick of eating only bread and decided to eat out instead. No wireless and the nearest internet cafe was 30 minutes away. Terrible hotel never again Disappointed aussies

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Location, Great staff. Fantastic all round..”
Reviews.Author: Alex Z
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the right location the Metro on your doorstep. The rooms were clean and spacious, linen changed everyday.Managerment and staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was set out lovely and eat as much as you want . with as much tea and coffee as you want served by two very happy polite ladies. If we ever return to Rome, we would most certainly re book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: james_matthee
Reviews.Content: Excelent location on exit of underground. Staff friendly enough if you're friendly. Remember - you're in Italy and they speak Italian. The whole world does have to have English as fluent second language. Breakfast adequite - unless you are one of those tourist who stock up lunch in your handbag from the breakfast table. Very good value. We enjoyed our stay. James, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALR91
Reviews.Content: On first arriving to the hotel we we're a bit taken aback by the fact that the hotel only occupies the two floors or the building it is located. but aside from that the hotel literally sits on the Bologna (Blue Line) metro which makes it an excellent base for exploring the magnificent city. Although it is on a main road and being a light a sleeper this was something that I struggled with but the rest of my party did not. The hotel is based in what we considered to be quite a residential area and because of this there were not many restaurants located in the area although the ones we found were excellent although for more choice would recomend possibly eating closer to the center if none take your fancy.(Although bear in mind that after 9pm the Line A closes). The staff were very friendly and even though we spoke little Italian we were able to communicate with them well. They were very attentive and when we encountered a problem with our room they were able to move us very quickly with no problem whatsoever. The rooms were basic but did offer television and mini bar and realistically we spent little time in them because we were exploring the city. The breakfast was good and offered a varied selection but not the greatest Like other reviews we were also asked to pay a city tax which is something we were unaware of so that's something to bear in mind it was apparently 2 euros each day per person. All in all a good stay and would reccomend if you are on a budget and not concerned about spending a great deal of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: murphstar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Laura what can i say: Good Points: *Hotel is beside the (Bolonga Metro stop) which makes it easy to get around Rome *Hotel is clean and tidy Bad Points: *Breakfast wasn't worth calling breakfast and you couldn't get what you wanted you had to wait till someone got it for you and in most cases this was the maid who was cleaning a room one min and next serving you your breakfast without washing their hands!!! *Extra €4 per day room tax which no-one told us about *Staff aren't helpful at all, seem to be there just for the sake of being there *Hotel is based on the 4th and 5th Floors of a building (never came across this before and found the hotel hard to find on first arrival *Found the hotel very nosiey at night so the walls most of been made of paper!! *Also in our room at night the lights keep on turning on and off in the middle of the night which was very annoying when your trying to sleep. Few more points but am not going to continue and make myself angry again!! Loved Rome and enjoy my time there but will not be back at Hotel Laura or will not be recommending it to people to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel Ruined by Incredibly Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: SaintCharlesTim
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Laura is literally just a few yards from the Bolonga metro stop, making it convenient to get around Rome. The room was comfortable, had the much-needed air conditioning, and was fairly priced at 70E. The breakfast was worthless, just bread (of various types), tea, and coffee. Someone had to get you what you wanted to drink, which was annoying. Sometimes I wonder why hotels even bother, other than they can advertise they have "breakfast." No real complaint, though, as we had no great expectation for their breakfast and therefore were not disappointed. But don't be fooled by the "free breakfast" advertised. What was disappointing - and this is where Hotel Laura gets a complete and total "Zero" - was the rudeness of one of the employees. My friend and I had checked out, but left our bags at the hotel for a few hours, collecting them later. No problem there.The hotel is on the fourth floor of the building. We needed to rearrange some of the items in our luggage, and since we had already checked out, we did this in a discreet corner of the street level lobby. (There is nothing in this lobby, it's merely an entrance.) We were not even in view of the front door. One of the Hotel Laura employees came in from the street and immediately yelled at us. I mean YELLED. He was screaming about how we have no respect for the hotel. (Please recall that this is not a hotel lobby; the hotel is four floors away.) He asked us if we understood him, as he was speaking Italian. Yes, we speak Italian too, but the man would not stop shouting for us to even answer! So, Hotel Laura, I will agree to never disrespect you again. And you will agree to never have my business again. On our next visit to Rome in October, we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyegr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Laura is situated away from the historical center of Rome, but this is not so much of a disadvantage, because it is located just in front of the Metro station, and is also served by bus n. 62 which stops at the Vatican city. You can reach the city center within 20 minutes with the metro, 15 minutes by bus and 10 minutes by taxi (costs about 12 euro at night tariff). In the neighborhood you can find a couple of ice-cream places, a supermarket, a pastry shop and some other nice and cheap stores. The hotel itself occupies floors 4 and 5 of an old building which only has a 4-person elevator. The rooms are small but clean and feature TV and mini-bar. No wireless internet is offered, but if you get a room with street view you may steal internet from a neighbor! The breakfast is limited to orange juce, coffee, cereals, croissants, marmelade and milk. The staff is helpful and kind. All in all, Laura hotel is a good choice if you are looking for a cheap, quiet, convenient but not fancy hotel. Rome is a fantastic city, so who cares so much about the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Small place but really cheap.”
Reviews.Author: llindhol
Reviews.Content: Positive about the hotel: Cheap, good location with the subway just outside the door. Takes about 5-10 min to go to Colesseum for exampel. Bus nr 62 leaves från Bologna just 2 min away from the hotel. Takes you straight to St Peters and other parts of the city. Other similair hotels closer to the city are much more expensive. Perfect to stay in if you just need a place to sleep and take a shower in. We spend all day enjoying Rome :) Very little tourists in the area and more locals. Good food places around with just locals there. Negative about the hotel: Small rooms. Bad breakfast (just some dry bread). The staff is not the most service minded people but still ok.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable good location”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the steps of the metro Bologna station and near the 62 bus which covers much of central Rome. The room and breakfast were reasonable but several small things remained broken after several reminders. Staff was pleasant though we struggled with the English

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: jameshayes
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel and it was great. The location is by far the best attribute - only 5 metro stops(6/7mins) from the colosseum. The metro is literally outside your door (no noise thankfully) The hotel has plenty of charm and is very homely. It is located in a building which it occupies the 4 & 5th floor. You step out of the lift and you walk into the hotel lobby. The hotel is very safe and secure - the external door is locked at night (you have to buzz reception to enter) The only problem I had with the hotel was the lack of a restaurant - although there are plenty around both walking and short metro. To locate this hotel from the Termini station - there are 2 metros, take the Blue one(the one with colosseum) - get off on the Bologna stop and walk up the steps & you will be at hotel laura I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JAM_879
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Europe that included a four day stop in Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Laura, and were very pleased with virtually every aspect of our stay. The front desk staff (Nora during the day, and Mario at night) were very friendly and helpful to us. The room was comfortable and in great order, and even included a little refrigerator with water, soft drinks, and beer that didn't cost much more than buying them at the store. It was a small room, but that is fairly standard in Europe so as an American one just has to adjust to that characteristic. At the price we paid (September 07) of 80 Euros/night, we thought it was an excellent value. While it would have been nice for the breakfast to include something other than croissants, cereal, bread and coffee, it was enough food to get us started in the morning. As for the location, the other reviews are accurate, you walk out the front door and the steps down to the metro are literally right there. From there, it's a matter of minutes to the city center, as well as numerous tourist sites across central Rome (e.g., The Vatican, Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, the Colloseum, and many more). Would we stay at this hotel again? Yes, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Less than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Cytree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the fourth floor of a building that is far from central Rome. We were aware that it was on the outskirts so this was not an issue for us. The subway is very cheap and easy to use and a station is located within steps of the hotel. There is also a taxi stand very close by. There are no good restaurants within walking distance, ditto for shopping. The staff consisted of one man and one woman. The man was pleasant and is helpful if you can converse with him in italian. The woman is very rude and border line iignorant. I bit my tongue numerous times at her tone. We were advised not to use an iron in the room in a very irritating way. Also the wait for our room to be ready was made as uncomfortable as possible. No help with storing luggage while we waited, so we had to stand by our luggage and wait the two hours or lug it all with us. The elevator is very small. It will hold one person and one piece of luggage or two people. So beware if travelling with luggage. The rooms are very small and the TV is tiny and only shows italian stations. There is no internet at the hotel and no cafe within walking distance. The rooms were moderately clean. Despite the claim to having air conditioning, it is turned off from noon until 2pm and then again at about 1 am until you request it turned back on in the morning. All in all we knew we were skimping on the hotel in Rome in order to enjoy Cortona and Sorrento but we certainly received far less than what we expected. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and i will not be returning to it.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Laura hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Youngtravelers_Qc
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in Laura hotel for 6 nights and we found it really convenient. It was strategically placed in front on the metro entrance and within 10 minutes, we were downtown to the main attractions. At breakfast, the coffee was delicous. The staff didn't speak a lot of english but they were nice. The room was larger than I thought it would be (for a room in europe I mean...), it was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was a good value for the price we paid. I would recommend this hotel. Young travelers from Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMctravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed there April 21-30, 2006 and it was very convenient. The metro entrance is located right downstairs, and after long day of walking around rome, there is a true appreciation of that metro stop! The train stops are fast and you get to the downtown rome quickly. Termini station interchange entrance closes around 9pm though. The Buses run later. The breakfast is basic, but there is lots of pizza places,and a wonderful cafe just outside. I had my chocolate gelato fix every evening at the cafe across the street. The room was clean, the sheets and bed was fine, the shower was small but that's europe. The bathroom itself has adequate space. The lift is extremely small so i walked up the stairs to fourth floor. It wasn't a major issue for me. The staff spoke enough english and was pleasant. Print out the rome metro map before you leave for rome and you can plan your vacation around the metro stops. For the price, this place was convenient, and worth it. I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value!”
Reviews.Author: Trish1917
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to get away from London for a long weekend, and no better place to go than to Rome. We contacted the hotel directly, they speak good English, but it helped that my mum is Italian. Hotel is situated on the 4th and 5th floors of the building (there is a lift). It's fantastic that the hotel is literally 10 steps from the entrance to Bologna Metro. Great after a long day queuing and walking in the centre of Rome (which is easy access via Line B from the hotel, or changing to Line A from Termini). You get bus and train tickets (same thing) from the little tobacco shops (there is one a few yards to the left of the hotel entrance. 1 euro for a single, 2 euros for a return (each single ticket lasts 75 mins once you put it through the machines on the buses and trains so you can travel anywhere in that time, the return is a seperate ticket again lasting 75 mins). Rooms are very nice, great value for money. If you can, get a room which isn't facing the street, as Rome comes alive after 11pm and they are up very early, so you might be woken by traffic if you are not a heavy sleeper. Rooms are all pretty similar other than that. If you need extra pillows, ask at reception. Bathrooms are a decent size with a huge sink, and double bed is a nice size too. Everytime you leave the hotel, leave your key at reception, it is 24 hours and when the front door is closed just buzz in and they will open the door for you. The only disappointing part was the breakfast. Just croissants, bread, spreads and coffees. The restaurants around this hotel are fantastic, tastes just like my mum's home cooked food. The person on reception will recommend them to you if you ask. There were at lest three that were superb and all within 2 minutes walking distance from the hotel. A tip though, if you are sightseeing or exploring the centre of Rome, please don't go to any of the restaurants near the attractions as the food is so bad, and so expensive, unless you've been recommended by someone you know. Don't listen to any well dressed men on the streets promoting restaurants and home cooked food as it is a lie - we were duped by this. Best to get a light lunch in a pizzeria and have a decent meal near the hotel in the evening. Get a taxi to and from the airport as the Metro gets so packced it's worse than London tubes, so lugging suitcases may be a problem. Also watch your bags, pick pockets are rife in Rome and on the Metro. Would definitely recommend the hotel, given the value for money, the proximity to the Metro and they are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice little place”
Reviews.Author: drjello
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. Both times with international friends who came in Italy to visit me. Hotel Laura is located in a very good spot, in the north eastern part of Rome. The sunway station is just in front of the hotel. As many small hotels/pensioni in Rome (and in Italy), hotel Laura in located at the 4th (or 5th- I can't remember now) floor of a building. The hotel has the whole floor. Rooms are very clean and the forniture is pretty new. They are not very big though. The staff is quite helpful and speaks good English. The free breakfast is ok- a little poor....but their cappucino is great! I will keep coming back to this hotel in the future.
